meanings.definition: A small platform on which to rest the feet while sitting.
meanings.sent1: I like to put my feet up on the footstalls when I watch TV.
meanings.sent2: The footstalls in the park are perfect for tired walkers to take a break.
meanings.sent3: The footstalls at the library are always occupied by people reading books.
meanings.sent4: Her cozy room felt like a haven with its footstalls inviting relaxation.
meanings.sent5: The footstalls on the bus made the long journey much more comfortable.

meanings.definition: A stall or compartment for the feet in a church.
meanings.sent1: The footstalls in the church were beautifully carved with intricate designs.
meanings.sent2: During the service, the parishioners knelt at the footstalls to pray.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to hide candies in the footstalls during the sermon.
meanings.sent4: The footstalls in the church seemed like sacred spaces for quiet contemplation.
meanings.sent5: The footstalls in the church were worn smooth from years of use by worshippers.

meanings.definition: A place where one may stand or walk.
meanings.sent1: The bustling city street was a footstalls for people rushing to work.
meanings.sent2: The footstalls in the garden were covered in colorful flowers.
meanings.sent3: The footstalls by the riverbank were a popular spot for picnics.
meanings.sent4: The footstalls in the market were filled with vendors selling fresh produce.
meanings.sent5: The footstalls in the park were a peaceful retreat from the busy city life.
